3: 'Facing the dragon, the champion remains steadfast. To protect their homeland, the champion raises their sword that represents justice and bravery.'
Is she dreaming or awake?
Who is she?
She is the princess, the traveler, and the piper, who became a pile of ashes long ago.
She is the wreckage by the beach and the breeze that caresses your face.
She is the flower that guides you forward, the champion sword, and the magical pipe.
Is she... a character in the play?
She has witnessed herself getting killed countless times.
She gazes at herself, and herself gazes back.
It is a pair of purple eyes that has never changed in these long-lasting cycles.
The eyes are filled with light and without regrets.
It is a pair of eyes that knows everything.
The story changes as our champion takes actions and makes choices.
...Facing the dragon, the champion remains steadfast. To protect their homeland, the champion raises their sword that represents justice and bravery.
The flowers on this land will blossom once more, and the princess will safely return to the kingdom. As for the evil dragon, it will die by the champion's sword.
The world is a stage.
The natures of those characters in the play are determined by their personalities. And their happiness is determined by their actions.
It has nothing to do with...
Is she... not part of the play?
Everything is so strange yet so familiar.
Who has been calling her?
